place.name: REEPHAM
place.gazetteerText: REPHAM, or Reepham, a village and a parish in the district and county of Lincoln. The village stands adjacent to the Lincoln and Hull railway, 4 miles E N E of Lincoln; and has a station on the railway . The parish comprises 1, 430 acres; and its post town is Lincoln. Real property, £4,028. Pop., 436. Houses, 87. The property is much subdivided. The Burton hounds are kennelled here. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £176.* Patrons, the Mercers' Company, London. The church is good; and there is a parochial school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
